post.text:
Night Taxi
***
Rheim Alkadhi
***
I am a fugitive heart 
En route to time's insurrection 
Pulsing through electronic fields measuring distance and dues 
To elongate a fleeting second 
With you 
My only motive
***
Night taxi passes over the earth's surface 
Via land and water 
Impatient 
Elapsing 
Transcendent 
Calculating contours and corridors 
Of an uneven topography
***
Amassing a collection of defunct borders 
Having lured them into disuse 
With a protracting glance 
With a kiss 
With an invitation to the real-that-resists 
You accept 
Night taxi crosses into the zone of arrival
***
Entering the geography under your skin 
I disrupt your surfaces 
Making your urban centers swell 
Circulating through you in lieu of currencies 
Taking note of your nervous system 
To better understand 
A border evaporating
***
Saliva script on an unlined atmosphere 
Issues from our mouths when we speak 
Tongues overlap in apocalyptic dialects
Intentions charted on collapsing mountains and rising seas 
Stop 
To drink from your lips: another kiss 
The world groans sideways 
***
Our edges meet in unfamiliar gravity 
Night taxi bends 
Turning all hearts fugitive 
Anticipating proximities 
Elongating seconds 
See you at the crossroads zero hour 
For the occasion of devouring your threshold
